newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Rato optimistic about inflation trend.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Rato optimistic about inflation trend.

text.p: Spanish Economy Minister Rodrigo Rato said on Wednesday that December consumer price data was "very good news" and said he was optimistic about the inflation trend in coming months.
"And I have to add that we can be optimistic if we keep doing things well," Rato told reporters before the opening of a seminar.
He added that core inflation at 3.0 percent year-on-year was proof that the government's policies were correct.
Spanish CPI rose 0.3 percent month-on-month in December, for a 3.2 percent year-on-year rate, and the core index rose 0.3 pct and 3.0 percent.
Rato added that December CPI was good news, a result of the government's efforts to reduce the public deficit and of each sector in Spain's economy to tame wages and control tariffs.
Rato didn't comment on the possibility of further cuts in the official interest rate after CPI.
"You all know that the Bank of Spain handles monetary policy," he told reporters.
